alert.note: Alert for Nowata; Osage (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 2:04AM CDT until June 06 at 4:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Craig, Delaware, Nowata, Osage, Ottawa and Washington OK. * WHEN...Until 515 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 203 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms building south from Kansas. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bartlesville... Miami... Vinita... Nowata... Grove... Dewey... Commerce... Fairland... Afton... Quapaw... South Coffeyville... Copan... Welch... Bernice... Delaware... Bluejacket... Wyandotte... Lenapah... Wann... New Alluwe... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
